item.title: Vyvx and Genesis Offer Worldwide Video Transport
item.description: The Power of Fiber for Video Transport Those working in video production, distribution, news, or sports broadcasting need reliable video transport. While satellites have been the traditional choice, fiber optic networks offer compelling advantages, including vast bandwidth, minimal latency, and accessibility in popular locations. The Level 3 and Global Crossing merger brought together their video transport expertise, resulting in a comprehensive range of services. Level 3’s Emmy Award-winning Vyvx service provides broadcast fiber services, managed video networks, teleport and satellite services, and venue-specific services.

item.title: The Coming Level 3 Global Crossing Juggernaut
item.description: The future of business hinges on strong global connections, and the merger of Level 3 Communications and Global Crossing aims to deliver just that. By combining their infrastructure, they’re creating a network with a truly global reach. This $2 billion acquisition will see their combined fiber optic network reach 70 countries across three continents. Level 3 brings a robust US network with long-haul and metropolitan fiber, plus transatlantic cables connecting major US and European cities with low latency.

item.title: 40 Gbps Bandwidth Available For Business
item.description: XO Communications has increased business bandwidth options by offering two 40 Gbps network services across its nationwide fiber optic network. Randy Nicklas, XO Communications’ CTO, highlights the advantages of these new 40 Gbps services: You can listen to the interview directly on this page: Clearly, we’re entering a new era of high-bandwidth applications for businesses and service providers like cable companies. High-speed financial trading needs the fastest speeds, with even milliseconds of delay impacting outcomes.

item.title: What Is Lowering Gigabit Ethernet Bandwidth Pricing?
item.description: The cost of Gigabit Ethernet bandwidth has decreased significantly in recent years, offering a welcome change for companies needing robust bandwidth for cloud computing, e-commerce, medical imaging, video streaming, and other high-demand applications. This price drop extends across various bandwidth services, including T1 lines, DS3 connections, OCx SONET/SDH fiber optic bandwidth, and Ethernet options ranging from Fast Ethernet to 10 GigE. Notably, Ethernet services often show the most substantial cost reductions per Mbps.

item.title: Handle Big Data With Big Bandwidth
item.description: The age of “big data” is upon us. But what does that mean? Big data refers to massive datasets that are too large for typical database management tools. This surge in data originates from sources like computer simulations, financial modeling, research projects, sensor data, and high-definition video processing, which generate terabytes of information rapidly.

item.title: Level 3 Vyvx Connects The Super Bowl
item.description: Super Bowl Sunday is a time for celebration, but behind the scenes, technology ensures a seamless broadcast experience for millions. Level 3 Vyvx VenueNet+ plays a crucial role in delivering high-quality broadcasts from stadiums like Indianapolis’s Lucas Oil Stadium, where their technology is pre-installed and managed by experts. Remote broadcasting, whether for radio or TV, can be unpredictable. Traditional methods often involve cumbersome equipment and potential signal disruptions. The demand for high-definition broadcasts further complicates matters, requiring substantial bandwidth to maintain picture clarity during fast-paced action.
